clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Encainide is a class Ic antiarrhythmic agent which was used for management of irregular heartbeats such as atrial fibrillation atrial flutter ventricular tachycardia and ventricular fibrillation

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Used to treat irregular heartbeats encainide decreases excitability conduction velocity and automaticity as a result of slowed atrial atrioventricular AV nodal His Purkinje and intraventricular conduction It causes a slight but significant prolongation of refractory periods in these tissues The greatest effect is on the His Purkinje system Encainide decreases the rate of rise of the action potential without markedly affecting its duration
